audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker jokingly commenting on a "bowl mask" as if it's "saying 'say what?'", followed by another male speaker quipping in response. The first speaker then complains that "my mouth is rotting away," and makes gross, unintelligible noises. Suddenly, there's a loud crashing sound, accompanied by what sounds like glass breaking, followed by the first speaker yelling in pain and fear, asking "what are those?" The clip concludes with a suspenseful musical sting.

The audio begins with a lively male speaker stating "All right guys, today I am in Jonesboro Arkansas," expressing he's there because "there is a weiner dog telling me to go in the Spirit Halloween," indicating he's excited to visit the store. The man goes on to describe the building as "a Spirit Halloween" that he believes "used to be a Pier One imports," hoping it has good "props and masks and especially animatronics."

The audio clip begins with the excited exclamation "Holy crap, guys," followed by a description of an encounter with a "skeleton zombie guy." The speaker expresses surprise and fascination with the figure. There are ghoulish, unidentifiable sounds, described as a "skeletal zombie guy." The tone becomes curious as the speaker observes the skeleton's features, like the feet, hands, and face. The speaker then invites listeners to identify the character in the comments, with enthusiasm.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker expressing uncertainty about one person's identity but excitement about another, whom he identifies as "Beetlejuice". He repeats the name with increasing enthusiasm, noting that there are "four of them" and expressing surprise that the "imports did come in." The speaker sounds excited.

The audio begins with speech, featuring a male speaker exhibiting excitement, announcing "Oh my gosh, they have two Baphomets," and clarifying "yes, I said Baphomet." He notes the presence of two Ghostfaces in stock, remarking on the dim lighting making it difficult to see, followed by another observation. Ambient noise is discernible in the background throughout the speech.

The clip begins with a man describing a Henry Hustle toy that is reduced in price, suggesting it might be related to "a TikTok charade". He then notices another set, "Maestro and Little Daisy", and expresses excitement. He notes some damage on the Henry Hustle toy, such as "head sits sideways", and finds the "broken" neck of the girl toy "almost cool."

The audio clip begins with a male speaker in an excited tone drawing attention to "two Evelyn leeches" from "the movie Stand by Me" , clarifying that they are "a different kind of leeches". The same voice, filled with enthusiasm, then exclaims "holy crap guys" and mentions "several Billy Butchersson pop vinyl figures", counting six of them. The speaker proceeds to list "a Sam", "two Shorties", and "two Love Rangers", questioning "what in the world" before quipping "cue the Barry White". The tone shifts as the speaker expresses hope for finding "some more animatronics sitting out", noting they aren't all set up. The clip ends abruptly with the exclamation "Oh".

The audio clip begins with a male speaker exclaiming, "Look at this though," and describes chains of death and shorty's clubs at a store. He then notices a light-up ghost face costume and mask. He tries it on, expressing his amusement by saying, "Oh, look at that," and commenting on its coolness. He states that he is enjoying the store. Finally, he expresses his surprise at the abundance of astronaut helmets. Throughout, his tone is casual and conversational.

The audio clip features a male speaker, who is excited while describing Halloween decorations such as white, blue, and black ones, a ghost face, posable dummies, Chucky greeters, and empty soul girl on a swing, and a creepy crimson girl. He mentions also Michael Myers greeters and that there are no animatronics. The speaker then describes spooky bricks and chains of death, clipboards, blueprints, and spooky bricks and chains of death. He believes they will be for sale at the end of the season. There are some background sounds, but these are not identifiable.

The audio starts with a male speaker excitedly mentioning Sam Groundbreakers and commenting on how cool they are. This is followed by the speaker stating that this is only the second place they've seen a trick-or-treat wagon. Then, they comment on a couple of Sam Sidesteppers, indicating their intention to interact with both. The sounds of the Sam Sidesteppers are then heard, accompanied by the male speaker's commentary, indicating when both are activated simultaneously. The speaker then states they've heard enough. Next, they comment on a scary gargoyle pathway marker, burning skull pathway markers, and address the rats. The speaker comments on cool skeleton candle holders and then mentions "hear no evil, see no evil, speak no evil" before addressing bad word sayers.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker excitedly commenting on some animatronics for sale, noting a night crawler is "reduced to 100 bucks" but "catches when going back down." He then describes a "hauntress" for sixty-five bucks that "does not work," followed by three "decaying zombie groundbreaker[s]" and a "cracked skull zombie ground breaker," noting the green eyes of the zombie when it appears to work. The speaker finishes with a description of a "pose and stay skeleton." Throughout the recording, a low-volume ambient noise is heard.

The clip begins with a male speaker, sounding excited, mentioning light-up balloons "from Pennywise from the It movies", expressing enthusiasm and describing flaming pumpkins, specifying their height. He shifts to describing "Mr. Arrow" and "Mr. Barbed Wire", characterizing one as having "an ugly face" and humorously telling him to put his tongue back in his mouth, followed by welcoming listeners to "Skid Row". He then refers to a "whole plethora of zombies" and, addressing a female, suggests she needs a new hairdo. Throughout the audio, there's low background noise, suggesting an indoor environment.

The clip begins with someone, presumably male, introducing a "kicking clown," praising its legs, and then pointing out "Mr. Vintage Frankenstein with the yellow light-up eyes." He then describes a vintage devil with yellow eyes and a scary, shaking nurse, humorously attributing her stress to having been fired for refusing a COVID shot. The speaker remarks humorously "that's some serious..."  before noticing a display where "this guy had this guy in a headlock and he gnawed his arm off." Then he greets other rats, almost misses a "whole stack of jumping spiders", and apologizes, never meaning to hurt them.

The clip begins with a conversational narration. The speaker, a male, discusses various horror-themed props, including "the Malachai knife from Children of the Corn" and "blood-curdling knives," remarking about seeing them in a common store. A second male voice chimes in with a rhetorical question about the props, showing agreement on how scary they are. The first speaker continues describing a "Phantom of the Opera mask," prompted by a request, and mentioning a "Jolly Wally mask." He then humorously decides to leave stickers on props, ending with a farewell. The sound abruptly transitions to a suspenseful musical score characteristic of horror films, immediately intensifying the scene. A scream rings out over the music, indicating a sudden scare or danger.
